summaryText: What an incredible Easter Sunday sermon from Pastor Travis Hearn about God's amazing grace! Pastor Travis shared a powerful personal testimony of his own transformation, revealing how God's grace can save us from our sins, ourselves, our situations, and ultimately from eternal separation. Drawing from his own life experiences of being arrested and making mistakes, PT demonstrates that grace isn't about being perfect, but about Jesus paying the price for our imperfections. Can you imagine a love so unconditional that even when we mess up, God still pursues us? That's exactly what grace looks like! Pastor Travis breaks down how God's grace isn't just a 'get out of jail free' card, but a transformative power that changes us from the inside out. The most profound moment was when he explained that sometimes God doesn't remove our 'thorns' (problems), but walks with us through them, using those very challenges to refine our character. Wow! The sermon culminated in an incredible altar call where over 100 people surrendered their lives to Christ - talk about resurrection power at work!
mainPoints: God's grace saves me from my sins
God's grace saves me from myself
God's grace saves me from eternal separation

versesMentioned.text: By the death of Christ we are set free, that is, our sins are forgiven. How great is the grace of God which he gave to us in such large measure.
For all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God.
In whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins.
I do not understand what I do. For what I want to do I do not do, but what I hate I do... What a wretched man I am! Who will rescue me from this body that is subject to death?
So if the Son sets you free, you will be free indeed.
Is anyone in trouble? Let him pray.
Call upon me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you will honor me.
Therefore, in order to keep me from becoming conceited, I was given a thorn in my flesh... But he said to me, 'My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.'
Blows and wounds scrub away evil, and beatings purge the inmost being.
For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
But because of his great love for us, God, who is rich in mercy, made us alive with Christ even when we were dead in transgressions—it is by grace you have been saved.
Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!
If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.

Monday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Monday.action: Reflect on an area of your life where you need God's grace. Write down one specific way you've seen God's grace work in your past struggles.
Monday.prayer: Lord, thank You for Your amazing grace. Help me recognize how You've been working in my life, even when I couldn't see it. Reveal Your transformative power in my heart today. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: 1 John 1:9: 'If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.'
Tuesday.action: Identify one area of your life where you need to take responsibility and seek God's grace. Make a genuine confession and ask for help to change.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, I acknowledge my weaknesses. Thank You that Your grace is sufficient. Help me walk in true repentance and allow Your power to transform me. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 12:9: 'But he said to me, 'My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.''
Wednesday.action: Share a personal struggle with a trusted friend or mentor. Practice being honest about your challenges and invite prayer and support.
Wednesday.prayer: Lord, teach me to find strength in my weakness. Help me understand that Your grace is most powerful when I'm most vulnerable. Guide me to authentic community. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Titus 2:11-12: 'For the grace of God has appeared that offers salvation to all people. It teaches us to say 'No' to ungodliness and worldly passions, and to live self-controlled, upright and godly lives in this present age.'
Thursday.action: Create a list of three specific behaviors or attitudes you want to change. Pray about each one and take one practical step towards transformation.
Thursday.prayer: God, show me where I need to grow. Give me the courage to say 'no' to things that don't honor You and 'yes' to Your transformative grace. Empower me to live differently. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Ephesians 2:8-9: 'For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith—and this is not from yourselves, it is the gift of God— not by works, so that no one can boast.'
Friday.action: Do something unexpectedly kind for someone who cannot repay you. Practice giving grace as you have received grace.
Friday.prayer: Father, thank You that salvation is a gift. Help me live in gratitude and extend the same unmerited kindness to others that You've shown me. Make me an ambassador of Your grace. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 5:20: 'But where sin increased, grace increased all the more.'
Saturday.action: Spend time journaling about God's faithfulness. Recall moments when His grace was evident, even in your lowest points.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, Your grace is greater than all my failures. Help me rest in Your unconditional love. Renew my mind and spirit with the truth of Your transformative grace. Amen.
